pageContext.claim: “We had 40 year old planes, we have 50 year old planes. You know the story, the grandfather flew it, the son flew it and the grandson flew it, the same exact plane. No, we have -- we have a military now, they didn't spend money on the military, they gave up their money.”
pageContext.analysis: The Air Force uses an updated version of the U-2 spy plane, not the same model that was flying five or six decades ago. A Cold War-era B-52 plane was refurbished in 2019, and another was refurbished in 2015. They did not fly continuously for 50 or 60 years.
